page.title: 01Woburn Safari Park
page.content:
The safari park concept came to Britain in the 1960's and one of the first to open was at Woburn. In the 1960's, the thought of driving through enclosures where wild animals, in particular lions, roamed free, was very new and exciting, contrasting markedly with zoos.
In the 1970's, large numbers of parks opened throughout the country and the pioneers had to continually find new attractions to attract visitors, especially those who had made a previous visit.
The result was, in the case of Woburn, a funfair, performing seals, cable cars, a miniature railway and a "space rider."
